interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Devil's Pass
Review Date: 2014/02/24
Store: Holly Goss  (Actor),     Matt Stokoe  (Actor),     Renny Harlin  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy
Product Description: ["In February of 1959, nine Russian hikers ventured into a remote area of the Ural Mountains. Two weeks later, all of them were found dead. What happened is a mystery that has baffled investigators and researchers for decades. It has become known as the Dyatlov Pass Incident. When five ambitious American college students are issued a grant to return to the site of the original events, they gear up with the belief that they can uncover and document the truth of what happened to the supposedly experienced hikers. But what they find is more shocking than anything they could have imagined. Retracing the steps of the Russians' ill-fated journey, the students are plagued by strange and increasingly terrifying phenomena that suggest that in spite of the desolate surroundings, they are not alone. The forces at work in the Dyatlov Pass Incident have been waiting for them. Based on a true story, director Renny Harlin's (Cliffhanger) DEVIL'S PASS is an edge-of-your-seat thriller that delivers nail-biting suspense right up to it's shocking final frame."]
Average Rating: 4.2
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Horror', 'Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Renny Harlin, Holly Goss, Matt Stokoe', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'IDFC9895DVD', 'Director': 'Renny Harlin', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 17, 2013', 'Actors': 'Holly Goss, Matt Stokoe', 'Studio': 'IFC Independent Film', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: The movie had an excellent plot and seemed to move along rather well until about two thirds through the movie, then it seems to lose its game plan and began rushing to the finale.  A three star revue in my opinion.

["In February of 1959, nine Russian hikers ventured into a remote area of the Ural Mountains. Two weeks later, all of them were found dead. What happened is a mystery that has baffled investigators and researchers for decades. It has become known as the Dyatlov Pass Incident. When five ambitious American college students are issued a grant to return to the site of the original events, they gear up with the belief that they can uncover and document the truth of what happened to the supposedly experienced hikers. But what they find is more shocking than anything they could have imagined. Retracing the steps of the Russians' ill-fated journey, the students are plagued by strange and increasingly terrifying phenomena that suggest that in spite of the desolate surroundings, they are not alone. The forces at work in the Dyatlov Pass Incident have been waiting for them. Based on a true story, director Renny Harlin's (Cliffhanger) DEVIL'S PASS is an edge-of-your-seat thriller that delivers nail-biting suspense right up to it's shocking final frame."]

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preferences:** Enjoys suspenseful and dramatic narratives, with a clear interest in action-packed content that includes crime and justice themes. Recently explored horror elements with a focus on thrilling and mysterious plots.

- **Content Preferences:** Values fast-paced storytelling, particularly narratives engaging with darker themes like violence and realism. Although generally appreciative of visual experiences, has shown a critical stance towards overused tropes and pacing issues in narratives, reflecting a discerning taste for production quality.

- **Rating Trends:** Tends to give ratings around 4 stars but has shown variability in recent interactions, indicating a more critical outlook when pacing and clarity falter in the plot. Recent feedback includes a lower rating of 3 stars for a film that lost momentum, suggesting a frustration with rushed conclusions.

- **Language and Subtitles:** Prefers content in English, emphasizing the importance of accessibility through subtitles.

Overall, this user demonstrates a strong affinity for thrilling, action-oriented films with depth, while maintaining a critical eye for pacing and storytelling coherence. The recent interaction highlights a readiness to engage with horror without overshadowing their core interests, accommodating a wider appreciation for suspenseful narratives.
